title: New Lucian, Ezreal and Kassadin short stories out on Universe
body:
Ezreal Story: The Curator's Gambit by Matt 'FauxSchizzle' Dunn https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_GB/story/the-curators-gambit/

Lucian Story: Hunter of Shadows by Anthony 'Ant in Oz' Reynolds https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/lucian-color-story/

Kassadin Story: Whom Does the Desert Know? by Laurie 'Scathlocke' Goulding https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_GB/story/kassadin-color-story/

replies.body:
this line from the {{champion:81}} story is making me hope for {{champion:82}} vgu
''The dread lord will rise again''
A Dread Lord? Great, that puts Runeterra's current number of apocalyptic threats at....what, six?

> [{quoted}](name=NotaRobot1006,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=hv0cWWxf,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-10-05T16:34:56.987+0000)
>
> A Dread Lord? Great, that puts Runeterra's current number of apocalyptic threats at....what, six?

Void annd Morde now..Im forgetting the rest...fk

They might be referring to Brand, Xerath, and the Darkin.

A-Sol, Syndra, the Ursine, and the Swimming City also could probably do some major damage, but they seem less interested in Runeterra as a whole and more particular factions.

That said it's entirely possible, as someone else pointed out, that the Dread Lord _is_ Morde, or potentially a Darkin.

So the current full list is:

The Mist

Mordekaiser (He's just using the Mist and has been around for even longer, so he counts as a separate threat)

The Void

The Darkin

Xerath

Brand

Maybe Veigar

Those two kids Zoe showed off a World Rune to

I hope we learn more soon about some of the stuff that was mentioned, especially Paretha and whatever cult (?) Januk was part of.
No Ashe short stories? I want it... :c
It'll probably be added later, which might mean it's longer. The Dreaming Pool and similar length stories were uploaded shortly after the smaller texts of their batches.

It's small, but I'm so happy that Ezreal's story continued on from one of his previous ones. Now not only did we get to see how he got the elixir, but why. It's such a small payoff, but seeing there actually be a payoff makes me so hopeful.

Yes, I liked so much the fact that it was a continuation and not just a separated story.
Since Ezreal first update I was wondering "What happened to this Elixir?!!?!?"

https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_GB/story/an-explorers-journey/

this is also new correct? i really appreciate the style of writing in this. character's point of view in this manner can be really fun and informative. it can tell us a lot about the character's thoughts and personality.

plus the map is updated as well. Ezreal surely spent a lot of time south of Shurima.
It's relatively new, but it came with the Ezreal reveal iirc

Lucian and Kassadin are like 2 sides of the same coin. 

Both lost wives (plus daughter for Kassadin), both fight against darkness. One against the Shadow Isles, one against the Void. 

Both are champions with dark past, using weapons originally not belonging themselves, depressive but motivated, affected by their enemy faction somehow, at side of greater good.

Their short stories are just too parallel to ignore and not notice things above. That's obviously what they intended.

Kassadin is just way worse off because he´s pumped full of void.

Which is all manners of bad for both body and mind.
That makes me so happy! I can dig into it like there is no tomorrow now as I was bored.
